content.description: Starting vertically below the split in the rock, moving laterally to the left, plenty of nice crimps, which on the slab feel great. Reach the horizontal crag for plenty of undercling and top out left.Â
content.location: Starting at the parking lot, take the Eastern most hiking path. Take the path aproximately 1 mile. You will rise about 500 ft. This rock is visible from the hiking path, no more than 10-15 feet from it. It has a distinctive split at the top of the slab that folds into a lateral crag. Little bit sketchy due to the height, but if you have a bouldering mat the base area is even enough for it.

content.description: A quick walk, a bit less than a mile from the parking lot to some boulders along the lower hiking path. Easy access to the boulders which range in the low V's. Decent beginner bouldering area.
